cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles south of the Mouth of the Mississippi River (or 355 miles southwest of Panama City, Florida)
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northeast toward the Florida Panhandle/northern Gulf Coast, then inland across the southeastern United States and offshore near the North Carolina coast late Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida Panhandle (Apalachicola–Panama City area)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mississippi/Alabama border to Yankeetown FL (Gulf side) and Grand Isle LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Florida Panhandle, then inland across GA/SC/NC
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible (peak 25–35 mph)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain totaling 2–4 inches Saturday into early Sunday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk in central–northern Florida peninsula during Saturday
